page.title: 15CAUSTON'S HALL FARM
page.content: Causton's Hall Farm is owned by the Royal Agricultural Benevolent Trust. It has been farmed by Mr P.Schwind for the past 12 years. The farm covers 900 acres of land. Crops such as wheat, barley , rape ,sugar beet, beans, and peas are grown. In the 1920s the farm employed 32 staff with extra during harvest time. However, only 5 staff are employed today due to the increased use of machinery. The estimated value of the farm is 1.8 million pounds, with the largest field being worth approximately 135,000 pounds. The farm has no livestock. One character who worked on the farm for 58 years, since he was 14 years old, remembers earning 10 shillings a week when he began work and that the farm had a flock of sheep and several pigs.
